snippet: The $3.1 billion Dream Center, a riverfront complex that is expected to cover six large city blocks, has ambitions to rival the Broadway theater district and the West End in London.
abstract: DreamWorks Animation SKG announces plans to develop a $3.1 billion cultural and entertainment district in Shanghai with a group of Chinese partners; the $3.1 billion Dream Center, a riverfront complex that is expected to cover six large city blocks, has ambitions to rival the Broadway theater district and the West End in London.

byline.original: By DAVID BARBOZA and BROOKS BARNES
byline.contributor: David Barboza reported from Shanghai and Brooks Barnes from Los Angeles. Jonathan Landreth contributed reporting from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The $3.1 billion Dream Center, a riverfront complex that is expected to cover six large city blocks, has ambitions to rival the Broadway theater district and the West End in London.

headline.seo: DreamWorks Animation and Shanghai to Build Dream Center Complex
headline.main: DreamWorks Animation Plans Shanghai Entertainment District
headline.print_headline: DreamWorks Animation Pushes Further Into China
